dialogues.text: At the last instant he must've sensed  something. He turned --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks up from the text, turns his head. There's:

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: About twenty feet away. He looks up from his transcript.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura Gordon stood here. No bus stop,  phone booth, stop sign in the way... (chagrined) She had a perfect view of the killer's  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie adamantly shakes his head as he moves to Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she couldn't have, could she,  because she thinks she saw Shu and  now we know she didn't see Shu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger looks dubious. Eddie grabs his shoulders, marching east on Pell, the way Jimmy Chin came...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cruising along without a care  but now I'm stalking you, I'm right  behind you, there's rage in the air.  You feel the rage, like an electrical  charge -- you turn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks Roger's head around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pull out a loaded gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shapes the fingers of his right hand like a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Time contracts, space explodes,  perceptions can't be trusted when I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie violently whips his finger-gun into Roger's face. R flinches -- we HEAR a shattering GUNSHOT -- and we're in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A forensic ballistics expert (GEORGE) has just test-fired Shu's gun into a long wooden box. He and Roger remove the ear-protectors. (Eddie hadn't bothered wearing one.) To R as he opens the box's lid:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guys in the field, they'll try  to bullshit you that comparison  microscopy's an exact science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying, we need to finesse a  little, we'll finesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie adamantly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George -- I told ya -- ! We don't  need to finesse this one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Jump back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He recovers the bullet with a pair of sterile forceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hang out, Eddie, I'll have  something preliminary in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My associate'll wait, George. I've  got good news of my own to deliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D.A.'s office is on the south side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mr. Reynard expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard's Receptionist is politely but terminally skeptic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll only take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but Mr. Reynard is running  about an hour behind schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just leave word: Mr. Dowd and  Mr. Kim plan to proceed with trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand, marbled. Eddie's footfalls ECHO as he lopes to the stairs. And now he hears a deep, sepulchral:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - ROBERT REYNARD stands at the far end of the corri shirt-sleeves rolled up, arms akimbo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did my girl hear your message  correctly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie ambles toward Reynard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so, or you wouldn't be  standing there, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The D.A. shakes his head, disappointed in himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I think I could deal  reasonably with a man who defends  coke pushers for free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyers face off, salvos reverberating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coke pushers pay cash. That subsidizes  the pot possession cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.A.s slip past, careful to stay out of the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now you've strayed from your  area of expertise -- dope -- into  street assassins. A subject on which  you're dangerously ignorant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm a quick study. Tell your  Deputy D.A. -- Rabin? -- that I'll  see him in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Dowd, you'll see me in court.  I'm prosecuting this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie takes a beat to absorb the news. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I surprised? It's consistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard nods in solemn accord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to have a talent for putting  non-whites behind bars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frost settles on the District Attorney's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll prosecute anyone who fucks up.  If that makes me look racist, it's a  trade-off I'll live with, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's big of you, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Reynard a farewell-for-now salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see vou in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does a little pirouette. Reynard's words, swelling out follow him as he dances down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll beat you, Ed. You can hide behind  the whole Bill of Rights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hurriedly descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we PAN the quaint townhouses and tenements we HEAR, OV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys shoulda been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND a WINDOW in which THREE SILHOUETTES are seen. In the context of the cityscape, there's a poignant -- even fear sense of their smallness and isolation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuckin' D.A. himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie paces, gesticulates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude was quaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Roger feels compelled to deliver bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Eddie? The, um, ballistics guy,  George...? He called, and... (uneasily) His tests show that Shu's gun fired  the bullet that killed Jimmy Chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is a fucking burnout case. I  didn't want him on the stand anyway.  Get more names from Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns to Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find me an expert witness on  the Joe Boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty is nearly as reluctant as Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best expert in New York is a Soc  professor at Columbia... (carefully) Apparently doing a hit was the way  to get into the Joe Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie levels a "So what are you telling me?" look at Kitt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there goes your theory about the  Joes giving up Shu to protect their  trigger man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I like that theory. And since  I'm not putting Twerp Professor on  the stand, and since I don't have a  better theory, I'm sticking with  that theory. Meantime I want pictures  of the Joes. What'll you bet there  was a guy in the gang looked enough  like Shu to fool the eyewitnesses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty and Roger halfheartedly nod. Eddie tries a pep-talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guy is innocent. We prod in enough  places, I don't care how solid this  case against Shu looks -- there's a  weak spot somewhere and when we hit  it the whole hideous thing collapses.  Better yet, we get our hands on  Chuckie Roeder, we don't have to  grope in the dark. Chuckie is the  answer man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty snakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've phoned every art supply retailer  and wholesaler in the Tri-state area.  No one's heard of Chuckie Roeder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you considered that Chuckie  Roeder's not calling himself Chuckie  Roeder these days? Get his mugshot  from one of the many law officers  who've got hotpants for you... then  canvass those art supplies places.  We're gonna win this one, Kitty, but  ya gotta believe...

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: Uneasy with Eddie's optimism, he stands, wanders back tow the bathroom. Then notices that the door leading to Eddie living quarters is slightly a jar.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE OPEN DOOR
dialogues.text: Roger sees a single bed in one corner, plain wooden burea opposite. But on the walls, something strange and beckoni As Eddie exhorts in b.g., Roger slips into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hung on a hundred hooks and nails are as many TIES. The w thrift-shop kind that Eddie wears to court. From a distan we can't distinguish the prints; the room is lit only by blinking neon across the street. As Roger sifts through t ties, we go in CLOSE on the big amoebas, the zaftig merma the oddball, dated patterns and paintings. It's as though each tie stands for a case won or lost, but fought. As th each loud, shameless tie is a piece of Eddie himself. Now, as he pulls the ties from their hooks to examine the Roger exposes old PHOTOS tacked to the wall and forgotten

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOS
dialogues.text: are mostly yellow, cracked, faded. Here is EDDIE twenty-f years ago, hair cropped, a Princeton undergrad. Five year later he's sprouted a beard and is posed with his graduat class at Yale Law School. Now it's the glory days of the mid-sixties and Eddie's in his prime, a longhaired defense attorney in denim and  leather... At a press conference, flanked by Abbie Hoffma and Jerry Rubin. In Washington Square Park, igniting an a war rally. At a Sheep Meadow Be-in, arm around a lovely young woman, toddler balanced on his shoulders, infant cradled in her  lap. Eddie's family on a long-ago spring day. And here is Eddie, about 30, in a swarm of student activi outside a Federal courthouse, clearly after winning an  acquittal, held high above the crowd like a conquering he Now we BRING UP an excited BUZZ of VOICES -- as though th crowd, in the photo, were somehow coming to life. OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of People vs. Shu Kai Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've hit the big time; it's clean, spacious, echoic. The previous courtrooms were, by comparison, mere vestibules. JUDGE QUEALY BANGS his GAVEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case has been tried before, but  you the jurors must make no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the Judge notices something amiss. He squints --

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: There's SHU. With his new bristly growth of head-hair and oversized suit, he appears thin and mild-mannered, almost bookish. At Shu's left sits ROGER, looking around, bemuse The chair at Shu's right is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where is Mr. Dowd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is alone in here, at the sink. He's just doused his face. He examines his reflection in the dirty mirror, try hard to like what he sees. HOLD for several silent BEATS Eddie gathers his strength and courage. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will hear from the detectives  who arrested Shu Kai Kim and found  the murder weapon in his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has now taken his seat beside Shu. Reynard is in th midst of his opening statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eyewitness will testify that she  saw Mr. Kim shoot Jimmy Chin in cold  blood. An expert who examined Kim's  gun, and the bullet that tore through  Jimmy Chin's brain, will testify  that Shu Kai Kim was the killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides over to the jury box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this trial is about much more  than Mr. Kim's guilt. It's a test of  our legal system -- the fairest,  most liberal in the world, in world  history... So fair and liberal that  lawyers like Mr. Dowd can manipulate  it on a whim to re-try convicted  killers. Well that's a trade-off we  can live with, provided we have the  courage to meet our civic obligations.  You twelve are all that stand between  society and every Shu Kai Kim itching  to get free. Quite a responsibility.  But one I know that each of you can  handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE paces off a large circle -- a territorial act in wh he is claiming the courtroom as his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture this. In a part of town that  thrives on its spirit of  celebration... good food, friendly  faces... one young man walked up to  another, out on the street, in front  of the tourists, and committed murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eddie pivots, we see that his hair is pulled back with bright blue ribbon. The Jurors see this, too. If he didn' have it before, Eddie's now got their full attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if Chinatown's shopkeepers  and restaurant owners pleaded with  the Mayor... I wonder if the Mayor  put pressure on the Police  Commissioner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie jigs over to the jury box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the Mayor said to  the Police Commissioner? I think the  Mayor said, "Arrest somebody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trailed off; the last word is whispered. As he opens his mouth again -- -- TWELVE JURORS crane forward to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ANYBODY!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older woman GASPS. The others merely flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The homicide detectives lead off. First up is MONTELL. Ea 40s, beefy, black, with a tough-but-fair persona. Reynard concluding his direct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, having brought Mr. Kim in  for booking, you arranged a line-up  with six other Asian males.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the results of the line-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the eyewitnesses picked Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie smiles broadly at Montell, who smiles back. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a fact that the "six other  Asian men" in the line-up were all  of the classic Mongoloid type, whereas  Shu has the distinct facial bone  structure of a Korean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. The witness is not an  expert in racial classification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a standard trick to pack a  line-up with men who resemble each  other but look different than the  suspect, so the suspect will stand  out for the eyewitnesses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argumentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie takes a beat, flashes another smile. Montell  reciprocates. Now Eddie shifts into his empathetic mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to use less than scrupulous  methods, true? The Mayor was pushing  you hard for an arrest, wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell sadly shakes his head. As empathetic as Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to disappoint you. But  the Mayor and I have never spoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few TITTERS in the GALLERY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was being metaphorical, Detective  Montell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a fancy way of being wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half-dozen REPORTERS can barely suppress their snicke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next up is SKLAROFF, a coiled, rangy cop in his late 30s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly what information led you to  arrest my client just two-and-a-half  hours after the shooting took place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a description of the suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "description"? What, Asian male 18  to 30, black hair, brown eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the prosecution table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badgering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had intelligence...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phrased to sound as likely as peace in Beirut. Sklaroff  struggles to contain his resentment. Carefully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had information bearing on Mr.  Kim's desire to gain admission into  the Joe Boys by assassinating a member  of a rival gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't this "information" come from  the Joe Boys themselves -- did they  not all but hand you Shu Kai Kim, a  Korean, an outsider?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection! Your Honor, this isn't  cross-examination, it's Mr. Dowd's  opening argument again -- and again,  it's pure fabrication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie essays another line of attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it unusual for a man who's  just committed a murder in plain  sight to bring the weapon back to  his apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calls for speculation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sklaroff has weathered enough abuse. Indignantly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're implying that I planted a  gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim's prints were all over it -- He  admitted it was his gun, f'r godsake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hastily) Your Honor, the witness' response  was non-responsive... I ask you to  strike it from the record...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Judge Quealy does just that, OS, Eddie backs away from the excitable detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he drifts back to the defense table, Reynard stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The People call retired Detective  Vincent Badalato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits. Wearing a confident grin for the benefit of a jurors who may be watching. Only Roger and Shu can HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm dying out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly reassures) It's okay, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff escorts the last homicide detective into cour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got another shot.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE BADALATO
dialogues.text: enters. In a wheelchair, pushed by his sister CONNIE. He' overweight and droopy-eyed, probably on pain pills. She's got the gait, physique and complexion of a spinster alcoh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Roger) A fucking wheelchair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explains) A spinal injury, in the line of duty.  It was in Kitty's report...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard concluding his direct. Mellifluous and caring, a  pediatrician to a kid with mumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you left the murder scene...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato clutches his original report. His eyes rake the  page, find the relevant section. He adjusts his glasses. voice is a whisper thickened by painkillers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At, un, ten-thirty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what did you do, Officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Badalato replies we FLASH BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene has been secured, photos and statements taken.  Police tape holds back GAWKERS. Jimmy Chin's shrouded BOD is loaded, on a stretcher, into the rear of the paddywago FIND BADALATO -- young, fit -- at the driver's side door the paddywagon, discreetly conferring with the DRIVER. No the DRIVER steps out, and Badalato climbs in, in his plac As he pulls the paddywagon away we HEAR, OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I proceeded with Decedent's body to  the office of the County Coroner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: questions the disabled detective, careful to be cordial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Badalato. You reached the  County Coroner's and signed over the  body, when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato finds the relevant section of the report. Focuse Fusses with the pages. Starts to answer -- then succumbs a terrible coughing fit. COMPASSIONATE MURMURS from the J The Bailiff hurries over, gently pats Badalato's back, po him a cup of water. Badalato downs it with effort. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Eleven-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie opens his mouth, to continue his cross. But now his eyes dart to the jury box, and what comes out is:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more questions, your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hurries past Reynard, in the rotunda, surrounded by REPORTERS. Looking well pleased with himself, the D.A. is engaged in a spontaneous, genial Q & A. Roger and Kitty catch up with Eddie, making for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fucking wheelchair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't put him in a wheelchair.  Reynard did. He can get around without  one -- it's all in my report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time to read every word  in every report, I'm too busy getting  killed in court... Meantime my  crackerjack investigator can't find  the goddam art supplies store where  Chuckie-fucking-Roeder works!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trio descends the steps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to chat but I'm meeting a  cop for drinks. He'll be bringing  the Joe Boys' mugbook, circa 1980.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie tries not to look overly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I need an expert on the Joes I  can put on the goddam stand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty pulls a BAG from her pocketbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie? Stick this up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hops into an idling CAB. Eddie pulls a length of PIPE from the bag. He and Roger t baffled looks. Then Roger notices the PRINTING on the BAG

dialogues.speaker: BAG
dialogues.text: As Roger reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Art's Supplies."

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Suppressing a smile, Eddie reads the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Everything For The Plumber".

dialogues.speaker: LONG ISLAND CITY
dialogues.text: Light manufacturing and loft-dwelling refugees from SoHo, separated from Manhattan by the East River. TIGHTEN ON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Eddie and Roger enter the warehouse. INT. Roger notes the PLAQUES that line the walls, from the Cha of Commerce, Urban League, etc., naming Arturo Esparza "E Opportunity Employer of the Year". At the front desks are three tough-looking SECRETARIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is "Art" around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECRETARY 1 squints at this bizarre interloper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He expecting you-all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but this won't take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coffee-colored YOUNG WOMAN gets up from her desk in the far corner. She hurries over to rescue the Receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mariquilla Esparza -- Art's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is abashed at her fine, radiant features. Roger tri not to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mariquilla"? It's a lovely name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marquilla turns her face, to hide her blush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a compact, powerful-looking LATINO (bald, bearde bespectacled) charges INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art Esparza. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods at Mariquilla -- she makes herself scarce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wander past Esparza, and into:

dialogues.speaker: THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: A multi-tiered space crowded with sinks, toilets, tubs... Black, white and brown MEN load skids, ride forklifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come back here... Anything  happens to you I'm liable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) I'm a lawyer. The firm is thinking  about renovating. Everything dates  back to the Sixties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roger) Do you see a toilet here you think  is really me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger joins in the snowing of Esparza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're considering one of those high  tech designs, what do you call it, a  "lowboy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me but we're not a store and  we're not a showroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has slipped away. Hoping to distract Esparza:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I read it's healthier? To sit  lower on a toilet? Y'know, with your  knees up, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza is suddenly -- angrily -- aware he's been had.  Sharply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Where's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: ON EDDIE
dialogues.text: Striding down a long AISLE bounded by tall walls of pipin He ducks around a SKID stacked with industrial sinks... R into a waist-high CONVEYOR BELT loaded with large cartons Starts to back away -- then sees, below the conveyor belt

dialogues.speaker: PAIR OF BOOTS
dialogues.text: The combat boots that he last saw aimed at his eye.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Freezes, for a beat -- then takes off down the length of conveyor belt... But the belt goes on and on, and so Eddi drops down and scuttles under it. As he gets to the other side and leaps up, he sees --

dialogues.speaker: CHUCKIE ROEDER
dialogues.text: Who sees Eddie, lets out a startled cry and drops the car he was checking, then spins on his heels and sprints away

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: gives chase, slipping on the contents of the spilled cart scores of loose spigots... Then he finds his footing, and races after Roeder down another:

dialogues.speaker: AISLE OF PIPES
dialogues.text: This one about thirty yards long. Now from the other end, moving quite fast, comes a FORKLIFT. Roeder dives out of way, climbing up the wall of pipes. Eddie clambers after him as the forklift DRIVER frantical downshifts -- and the point of a prong catches Eddie's  pantleg, tearing it, as --

dialogues.speaker: ROEDER
dialogues.text: scurries over the now-collapsing wall of pipe, onto a dou skid of horizontally stacked HOT WATER HEATERS...

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Eddie stumbles after him... Both men struggling to stay  balanced... Now, just as Eddie is about to seize him, Roe reaches a steep ladder -- he breathlessly climbs up to:

dialogues.speaker: A CATWALK
dialogues.text: Eddie claws his way up the ladder, right behind... He tak a flying leap at Roeder, grabbing hold of his belt... But the catwalk sways, sickeningly, and Roeder kicks free nearly sending Eddie over the side. Now Roeder bolts to t far end of the catwalk, fairly flying down the ladder the Meantime, Eddie takes a breath and drops off the catwalk. twenty feet down, and just an arm's length from Roeder. B as he thrusts out his hand, a HUGE MAN intercedes, hurlin Eddie to the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: ROEDER
dialogues.text: dashes across a sea of TUBS, his boots CRACKING several.. Then OUT a BACK DOOR, disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Eddie -- winded and disoriented -- is yanked to his feet a flushed Art Esparza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muscular EMPLOYEES, brandishing pipe-wrenches, etc., have formed a menacing ring around Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's cool! Back off... take  five!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts briskly walking Eddie back to the front office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm a lawyer and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't care who you are. You  could've been killed. Every man and  woman in here has done hard prison  time. And we look out for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did five years in Attica. Lot of  cons helped me in the joint. But I  never got help from any lawyer... I  built this business for guys like me  who couldn't get a break anywhere  else. "Art's Supplies" is for ex- cons. Not lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're reached:

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT OFFICE
dialogues.text: Roger is waiting here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie Roeder's a material witness  in a murder case, Mr. Esparza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza is pained to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie... Never learn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then remembers he's with civilians. Collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Art's Supplies" is founded on trust,  Mister --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dowd. Eddie Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd had the sense to ask for my  help, I might've helped you. But  you've probably scared Chuckie Roeder  off for good, I have a whole bunch  of jumpy employees to handle and  you're both going to be on your way.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: As Eddie and Roger cross to the Riviera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam it... the little punk bests  me again, I get thrown down and  lectured at and where the hell were  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1530 Rivington Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie's address. I sneaked a peek  at the Rolodex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sneaked a peek at the Rolodex. (then) Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie parks at a hydrant, the lawyers hop out. Eddie goes the trunk, forces it open, finds what he was looking for. Tucks the tire iron into his pants. Roger was already checking the addresses on this stretch lower East Side transient hotels and pawn shops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Eddie? 1530 Rivington...

dialogues.speaker: 1530 RIVINGTON
dialogues.text: A hole in the ground, surrounded by a fence that's decora with a fanciful sketch of a luxury condominium that'll ne be built and some pretty words about urban renewal signed His Honor Edward I. Koch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on the corner pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty, when they demolish a  residential hotel, the city has to  relocate the tenants! Housing  Authority'll have records of -- (then) You taught me that? So why'm I wasting  my breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasant, middle-class decor. We haven't been here before We HEAR a persistent KNOCKING. KITTY crosses to the door, squints through the peephole a sighs. Then opens the door. ENTER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, these things take time.  Particularly at this hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's all over the room, edgily picking up odds and end

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy at Housing's waiting at home  for a pass to get back in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime Eddie has found a BINDER on Kitty's coffee table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Joe Boys in 1980...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of them are dead, three are  in prison, one's a waiter... Two --  you'll enjoy this -- two are actually  members of the Chamber of Commerce.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MUGBOOK
dialogues.text: Like the one the cops showed Eddie. But instead of sneeri tattooed whites, here are sneering tattooed Asians.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Eddie looks up from the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't do me much good unless I  know what Shu looked like back th--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty hands him a photocopy of Shu's 1980 mugshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying it) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: THE MUGSHOT
dialogues.text: An ornery-looking Shu Kai Kim wearing a greasy shag hairc A far cry from Mrs. Kim's "Small, Small World" photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I was right about the distinctive  facial bone structure of a Korean. I  thought I was bullshitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all over the room, waving Shu's photo, fulminating:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The odd man out always takes the  fall! Haven't I been saying all along  that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly aware that Kitty's watching him play Edward C. D Legendary Hell-For-Leather-Lawyer, he falters, embarrasse But Kitty's expression is affectionate, approving -- this just the spirit that drew her to Eddie years ago. Sensing this, Eddie relaxes. His voice softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't thanked you for your work,  Kitty. You're doing good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a professional, Eddie. Getting  paid is all the thanks I require.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes) I haven't paid you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (little smile) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat passes between them that's both intimate and awkwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any booze in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't drink "booze".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, if I wanted to make love with  you again, I'd do it sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie gently places his big hands on Kitty's slim shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie this is silly... are we supposed  to pretend nothing's happened in the  last ten years and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing has. But that's all changing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touched by Eddie's optimism, Kitty kisses him. It's meant be quick and light but he embraces her and the kiss conti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK. A phone RINGS. It's answered. Groggily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yes? (then) Oh. Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty repeats Roeder's current address, in VO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 913 Delancey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eddie's Riviera pulls up to a Bowery flophouse. He goe to his trunk, for that tire iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ancient NIGHT CLERK is asleep, his head resting on th Front Desk. Gimlet-eyed, Eddie peers at the NAMES taped t the mailboxes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Musty, narrow, dimly lit. Muffled, debauched LAUGHTER...  Eddie squints at one door, then another, then: Room 2D. He takes a breath, pulls out the tire iron, KNOCKS with i No answer. Eddie tries the door. It's unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCKIE ROEDER sits quietly at a plain wooden desk in the darkened, unadorned room. Scattered across the floor are  well-thumbed copies of Guns & Ammo and Blueboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Roeder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waxy and still -- like a Duane Hanson sculpture. Right ha suspended over the left forearm.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: sharply inhales as he ventures closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SYRINGE in Roeder's right hand, needle jammed in a vein The left arm is dotted with track marks.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Eddie slowly backs away from the upright corpse. Gripped by horror, but the strangest sort of pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie Roeder is laid out in a locker drawer. On one sid stands a MORGUE TECH; on the other, Detective 1 (from the police headquarters scene). Roger is off in a corner, giving a statement to Detective Eddie stands nearby, moodily contemplating the demise of last, best hope. OS, he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I guess you found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ART ESPARZA has entered. His face is flushed with emotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had no family. I have to I.D.  him. I'm his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie nods, not sure what to say. Esparza grimly regards  Roeder's corpse, then nods at Detective 1. A tear slides  down his cheek as the MORGUE TECH slams shut the drawer.  Esparza turns to Eddie. His voice thick:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be able to use him now,  will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger wraps an arm around Eddie's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Eddie, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's goddam tragic, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for Eddie, who doesn't speak or even move to de himself. Detective 1 grabs Esparza in time, holds him bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, get outta here, Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Roger exit with Detective 2. They're in the Cit Hall district, not far from the Criminal Courts Building. As the Detective crosses, returning to Police Headquarter adjacent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in over your head, Dowd...  Don't you defend pot smokers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie ignores. He and Roger keep walking, the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean, Roeder's gone, now...  A dead end. Believe me, I'm sorry  too, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaks the news) I've heard from the last ballistics  expert on the list. It's an even ten  who say Shu's gun killed Jimmy Chin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I hate experts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie... it's one thing to compare  Clyde Gruner to Jesus Christ. It's  even okay to claim that Shu Kai Kim  is just slightly holier than the  Pope... as long as you don't really  believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- you believe what you want.  Shu Kai Kim is innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I know? 'Cause Reynard  says he's guilty, and Reynard's full  of shit! Look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intoxicated by his illogic, Eddie yanks out his battered  wallet. Tugs out one of his two photos of Shu -- the "Sma Small World" snapshot from Mrs. Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the face of a killer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands it to Roger, who hands it right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're carrying that around like it  was a picture of your girlfriend! (blurts) I don't want to see your heart broken  when this case crashes and burns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim resolve) That's not gonna happen. I'm gonna  create reasonable doubt. Buckle your  seatbelt and watch me work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie steps into the street, into traffic. Cars wildly sw around him, drivers HONKING in outrage. Roger looks both  ways, dashes out. Catching up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Roeder's dead. Ballistics says  it's Shu! We don't have one witness --  unless we put Cecil Stipe on the  stand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not that desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. Eddie -- we've got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a meeting in Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned, sighs) Let's get a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Roger -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indicating with a gesture that they're only blocks from  Chinatown. Puzzled, Roger peers back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird -- I pictured the morgue  being way across town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After two beats he turns around to find Eddie gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty but for a banquet table Eddie shares with SIX PILLA (ranging in age from 30 to 80) of the Asian community. Th table is laden with delectable dim sum dishes. Eddie is t only one not eating -- he's too busy sucking up to his ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you in court. The jury'll be  swayed by your support. You men are  the backbone -- the conscience -- of  your community!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pillars are unmoved. Eddie lightens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only people who've sat on my side of  the courtroom so far are a wino trying  to stay warm and a bail bondsman I  owe money to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, guys -- the dignity of your  race is being threatened here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he gets a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the dignity of our race is  threatened, it is threatened by your  reopening of this ugly case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a violent thug is taken off the  street, our quality of life -- and  commerce -- immeasurably improves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Pillars nod. Eddie's gorge rises as they resume eating, sipping tea, quietly conversing in Cantonese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A violent thug"? I happen to know  that two of you were once Joe Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets the table's full attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not here to point the finger.  I did dumb things when I was 19 too --  we all did. Wrong time, wrong place,  everybody here could've made a perfect  fall guy instead of our lives turning  out how they did. This case is about  all of us. And you're gonna feel  like a bunch of goats when the truth  comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, one wouldn't try to bully such a venerable bunch unless one were desperate, unhinged, or a bit of both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll kick yourselves for standing  on the sidelines while the D.A. made  you out to be fungible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now PILLAR 1 whispers to PILLAR 2, who whispers to PILLAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. But what is "fungible"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interchangeable. As in, "Hey, maybe  we got the wrong guy but what the  hell, one slanty-eyed sonovobitch is  the same as the next"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your dumplings, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lopes out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard concludes his direct examination of the Police Ga Expert, a florid, 50ish Irish Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So according to your information,  Detective, the Joe Boys normally  used aspiring members -- like Shu  Kai Kim -- to do the "hits"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you got into the gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Your witness, Mr. Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: In the GALLERY, on Eddie's side of the room, sit the SIX  PILLARS. Some have brought their equally dignified WIVES. And several sweet-looking CHILDREN. EDDIE rises INTO FRAME as he stands at the defense table, newly energized. he straightens his mermaid tie and assum a look of collosal incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the police expert in Chinatown  gangs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...For ten years, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you speak Cantonese, Mandarin, or  both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Me? Neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie cups his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon... Which dialect do you speak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns to the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hoped-for HUBBUB among the Pillars et al. SHU cranes see, heartened and slightly amazed at the support. Turning back to the government witness:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't speak any Chinese dialects?  Then you get your intelligence from  snitches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badgering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between gritted teeth) They're Chinamen who speak English.  We call them informants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thunders) And I call your testimony hearsay. I  have no more questions for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall opposite the jury hang TWO POSTERS. Apparentl identical photos of a spent BULLET, deformed by impact. I front of them, wielding a pointer, stands Reynard's vener BALLISTICS EXPERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearing in mind that every gun barrel  leaves a distinctive mark on the  bullet it fires, we must conclude  that the bullet that killed Jimmy  Chin was fired from Mr. Kim's .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the powder burns at the site of  the victim's entrance wound...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Can also be linked to the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Your witness.

dialogues.speaker: ON EDDIE
dialogues.text: as he jigs over to the wall and grabs the pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photo on the left shows the bullet  that killed Jimmy Chin, true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the one on the right is the bullet  you test-fired from Shu's gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie contemplates these apparently identical photos. And manages to sound a note of outraged disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have the court believe  that these two bullets were fired  from the same gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie presses the tip of the pointer to a thin smudge alo the lower edge of the right bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see a groove here. I don't see a  groove here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pointing, now, to the lower edge of the left bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a significant difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's pointer finds another mark on the rear of the rig bullet. Or maybe it's the shadow cast by the pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about this? I don't see  this on the other bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to something else on one of the enlargements -- but so quickly, we're not even sure what he was pointing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or this -- is this a significant  difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it is not, Mr. Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though baffled by the Expert's criteria, Eddie sets do the pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the best of your recollection,  were you sober when you performed  the tests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GIGGLE from the Jury Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forensic ballistics isn't an exact  science, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It most certainly is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there a ten to fifteen-percent  margin of error?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. No more than seven  percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, seven times out of a  hundred, you're wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EXPERT stews. The PILLARS nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stand: LAURA GORDON, the young white eyewitness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell the court exactly  what you remember seeing on that  evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget it. I was walking  east on Pell Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she continues, we FLASH BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man walked past me. I noticed him  for two reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KILLER hurries by. ONSCREEN for only a second -- but  long enough for us to see he looks a lot like Shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was walking very fast and his  hand was shoved inside his jacket. I  was in front of a restaurant called  Andy Lee's... Something told me to  turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the Killer's back as he races to an intersection where several PEDESTRIANS wait for the Walk signal. We gl his face again as he pulls a gun... The YOUNG MAN in fron of him whirls, there's a sharp CRACK and then the YOUNG M is lying in the street, blood welling around his head. The Killer takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the man whom you saw murder Jimmy  Chin. Is he in this courtroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Gordon nods at Shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him sitting right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE stands before the witness box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Gordon. I have studied the  diagrams and the photographs and I  have visited the murder scene and  the conclusion I keep reaching is...  and I hate to have to say this...  You weren't even close enough to see  the killer's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Gordon is shocked by the rawness of Eddie's accusatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Mr. Dowd have a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes boring into Ms. Gordon's:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now. Did you see the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can describe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was silver, with a stubby barrel...  snub-nosed, I think they call it...  It wasn't automatic, it had one of  those... cylinders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't remember that -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see the hammer still, it was  cocked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though pained) How can you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't take my eyes off it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is facing the JURY -- only they can see the smile t sprouted on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ms. Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUSH in the COURTROOM. And now Ms. Gordon realizes she' been tricked. As Eddie returns to the defense table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the whole time, of course. I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting) No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHU turns to Eddie. The look on his face says "Hell, we'r actually holding our own." As the frustrated eyewitness is led off the stand we HEAR calm, resonant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor... The People wish to  call a witness whose name does not  appear on the witness list. He --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's smile evaporates. He leaps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, that's trial by ambush!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just discovered him, your Honor!  His appearance is critical to a fair  presentation of our case! He is an  inmate at Ossining Correctional and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Objection, your Honor! This case  has no connection with any subsequent  act my client may be charged with!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness will substantiate Mr.  Kim's modus operandi. It's  circumstantial evidence in the case  at hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Judge Quealy ponders, the D.A. keeps up the pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness is recalcitrant, your  Honor -- I had to personally make a  body attachment this morning -- it  took two Marshalls to drag him here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great personal sacrifices endured  by Mr. Reynard have no bearing on  the legal issues, your Honor -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I know as much about  these gangs as anyone; I'm well aware  of the secrecy in which their  machinations are cloaked... I assure  you this witness offers the court a  rare opportunity to place the  defendant's crime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- alleged crime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- in a context.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyers anxiously wait as Judge Quealy considers. Now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will allow the witness to testify.  With the understanding that your  questions are confined to the area  of Mr. Kim's modus operandi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- With objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So noted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie skulks back to the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As their final witness, the People  call Richard Ortega.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff swings open the rear door. Escorted by the a  forementioned MARSHALLS, enter ORTEGA, from the opening s He looks resentful and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard begins his direct examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ortega, you've known the defendant  at Ossining Correctional for how  long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would tend to plead the Fifth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invalid invocation, Mr. Ortega. What  I call "name, rank and serial number"  questions are not covered by the 5th  Amendment. You must answer counsel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYNARD looks pleased; ORTEGA, grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ortega... What is "La Compania"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cubano army, basically... inside  and outside prisons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And its purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting the Aryan Warriors and the  Black Guerrillas, basically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For control of the prison drug trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would tend to plead the Fifth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ortega, you've already answered  questions about La Compania. You  cannot now selectively invoke the  5th Amendment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard glows with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, that's not fair -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) Complain to the Bar Commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy turns back to the witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question, Mr. Ortega.  Your unserved time can double...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prospect of an extra day in prison fills Ortega with  despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the rival gangs compete for control  of the prison drug trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we do some of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your rank within La Compania?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortega hesitates. With a tight smile, Reynard reminds him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Name, rank and serial," Mr. Ortega.  Let's not hide behind the Fifth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surly) I'm a soldado in the G-Wing Regiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does a soldado -- a soldier --  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldado, he runs messages and  materiel between the regiments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Materiel"? What do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarettes, candy bars... (then, concedes) PCP, crack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a member of the Aryan Brothers  tries to cut in on your distribution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A soldado, he takes care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By "takes care of," you mean "kills".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Defense Table, Shu stiffens. So does Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ortega, what is Shu Kai Kim's  rank within La Compania?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it unusual for an Asian to be  accepted into a Cuban prison gang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu's the only one I know of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why was an exception made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinatown. Sounded pretty cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to say Mr. Kim told you  that he murdered Jimmy Chin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. Leading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tone is stern. But for once he doesn't stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overruled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortega looks past Reynard, at Shu. Mournfully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, they got me all fucked up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy POUNDS his GAVEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ortega! I warn you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Did Mr. Kim confess to you that  he killed Jimmy Chin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I think he mentioned it, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard turns to face the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words Shu Kai Kim is, and  always has been, a killer for hire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard's epithet reverberates in the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Withdrawn. The People rest.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Shu stares down at his penny-loafers. Eddie rises. Dully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I move that the witness's testimony  be stricken. He has clearly been  terrorized by the prosecution, he's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The testimony will remain in the  record. Do you wish to cross-examine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Eddie can answer, Ortega jumps up and SHOUTS, at S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, man -- ! Motherfuckers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bailiff rushes to the witness box as Judge Quealy POU his GAVEL. And suddenly SHU leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me outta here! I never wanted  this -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marshalls obligingly drag Shu toward the prisoners'  entrance, behind the bench. The JURORS appear shocked and alarmed. The SPECTATORS sta transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Court is hereby adjourned until ten  a.m. tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie just stands there. The sky has fallen on him. Now  Reynard rises at his desk. He catches Eddie's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you've learned something, Mr.  Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he and Rabin briskly exit the courtroom together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spectators -- including KITTY -- emerge. The PILLARS their FAMILIES disperse quickly, silently. Here comes EDDIE. What has seemed a merry jig in court no looks like a limp. ROGER behind Eddie. He moves to catch up, but sees that E is moving toward Kitty, waiting at the exit door. So Roge hangs back. But without even slowing down or giving a sign, Eddie mov right past Kitty, and out of the building. Shocked, Roger goes to Kitty. Gently touches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It was always like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't one of us...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- leave him be. It's better for  everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger nods, resigned -- and then someone else in the depa CROWD catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: Furtive and alone, hurrying away.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Roger turns to Kitty, an odd look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Would you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty shrugs: sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyer and his client face each other through a pane bulletproof plastic. Each has a telephone in front of him both fretfully finger their receivers. Eddie picks up fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a bit you didn't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I joined up I took an oath of  secrecy. I told you what you needed  to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's words hiss, like steam escaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need to know that a man I'm  defending on a gang-murder rap is a  prison soldier who kills over drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was self-defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Chin? Was that self-defense  too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response Shu hangs up. Eddie POUNDS on the plastic, to get him to pick up again. Shu does, provisionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's just -- You'll laugh  but there was awhile when I thought,  Hey, we're two sorry assholes who  need each other. Who can help each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though he couldn't possibly have heard this right:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- How could I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By trusting me. Shit, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off, momentarily defeated by the magnitude of w been lost. Now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my face kicked 'cause I trusted  you. I couldn't find an expert to  say it wasn't your gun killed Jimmy  Chin but it didn't matter... I went  up against the goddam D.A. himself  but I didn't care because I trusted  you, because I believed in you,  because I thought there was a bond  between us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a spurned lover who can't let go, Eddie implores Shu through the plastic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu looks at Eddie is though he were an alien life form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out there and I'm in here. My  bond -- my trust -- is with the dudes  in here that watch my ass. I took an  oath of loyalty to them. You're out  there. Who are you to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he continues, a simmering resentment heats up his word

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you leave this place you're  going out to dinner or a movie or  get laid. Where's our bond? I'm going  back to my cell and wait to die. So  tell me: Where's our bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For awhile we had this dream we were  innocent. That was our bond... but  then we woke up. And now I'd like to  hear everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "everything"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With exaggerated calm, to cover the rage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Chinatown, Shu. Tell  me the tr--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu hangs up. Rocks to his shackled feet. And shuffles ou of the room, to return to his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the gated window, a WOMAN and MAN -- surely Art a Mariquilla Esparza -- are seen in silhouette. Business ho are over; the couple is alone in the front office. Mariqu sits at her desk, Art paces the office. Now, as he passes her chair, Art leans down and kisses the top of his wife' head. She involuntarily stiffens. Art takes umbrage. MUFFLED WORDS. Mariquilla rises, grabs her raincoat. Art touches her shoulder, entreating. Mariq shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching this shadow play from the opposite curb. In b.g. the shimmering lights of the 59th Street Bridge and  Manhattan's skyscrapers seem worlds away from this misery

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO "ART'S SUPPLIES"
dialogues.text: As Mariquilla exits the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hurries along, lost in her thoughts. Now Roger fal into step beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mrs. Esparza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She startles slightly, then quickly recovers her composur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Roger Baron. I work with Edward  Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariquilla gives no sign that this means anything to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you... Why were you at  Shu's trial this afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pace quickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed you here from court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flustered) I knew Jimmy Chin. The boy who was  shot. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make sense) ...And you were at the trial to...  to see that justice was done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She briskly rounds a corner. Roger stays on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it was your idea to have Chuckie  Roeder scare Eddie off the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Why don't you ask Chuckie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reminds her) Chuckie OD'd, Mrs. Esparza. He's  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariquilla seems to flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art didn't tell you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariquilla abruptly stops and turns to him. Imploring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Mister --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Roger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't talk to Art. You mustn't  tell Art that I was at the trial. Do  you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is animal fear behind Mariquilla's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you lost a friend... You've got  a right to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A realization forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... Were you and Jimmy Chin...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mariquilla gazes into Roger's open, questing eyes. They'r the same age, but one has lived much longer than the othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk to you anymore. Go away,  please... Never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, she crosses the street. Slipping into darkness

dialogues.speaker: ROGER
dialogues.text: watches her disappear. And then, after two beats, he resu walking, back the way he came, toward the subway station.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: A figure, lurking in the shadows, lights a cigarette. As match flares we make out the face of ART ESPARZA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glassy-eyed Eddie KNOCKS and KNOCKS. Finally the door,  still chained, opens a crack. An eye peers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Do you realize I haven't gotten  stoned since the trial started?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes. Then reopens, unchained. Kitty stands th in a robe she's thrown on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie... A guilty client's not the  end of the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXACTLY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams his fist against the wall. OS, NEIGHBORS SHOUT f him to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's liberating! I feel free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More COMPLAINTS, OS. Shouting back at the neighbors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty turns back to Eddie. Tenderly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie... go home. Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need sleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need sleep. Some of us are mere  mortals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you too, Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, and skulks back down her hallway into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A converted brownstone in Chelsea. Eddie sinks down on th stoop, head in hands. Presently KITTY emerges, and sits d next to him. Several silent BEATS. Then Eddie speaks., lo straight ahead, not at Kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For years I've defended scumbags.  Dealers. Hitters... And somehow it  seemed fine until this kid came along  who knew me as a true believer who'd  fought the good fight and... but...  he seemed so damned disappointed in  who he found... and then, out of  nowhere, here we were fighting to  free an innocent man -- an innocent  man, I don't see many of those in my  line anymore and I thought, Wow, the  kid brought me good luck, y'know?  For one minute I was a true believer  again. Well, my minute is up, Kitty.  I'm going back to defending  scumbags... But not just dope dealers  anymore. From now on: Child molesters.  Porno merchants. Repeat drunk drivers,  and I'm gonna get 'em all off. Hit  men... Send me every contract  killer... None of 'em does time ever  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, faltering a little. Kitty stands, steadies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie. We can discuss this... after  you get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shakes his head. As he stumbles down the steps:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Kitty -- no more sleep  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie wanders up to his funky building. There's a SLEEPING BUM curled up in front of the door. Ed wearily leans down, to nudge the Bum aside. But it's ROGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger awakens very fast. He jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie -- it's Art Esparza!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Art Esparza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he hired Shu to kill Jimmy  Chin... It wasn't a Chinatown gang  hit -- Jimmy Chin and Art's wife  were lovers! She just about told  me...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled) You phoned up Art Esparza's wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed her from the courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza's wife was at Shu's trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you spotted her in the crowd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger nods. Eddie takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you, trying to show me up  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY PAST the odd HOOKER and VAGRANT being led from book to the bullpen. The unnatural quiet bespeaks the late hou CAMERA PUSHES into Records, closed for the night... Pacin here is TOMMY, the cop who'd opened up the Exhibit Wareho for Eddie, earlier. Tommy appears to have been dragged ou of bed. Under his car coat is a flannel pajama top. Betwe tense puffs on his cigarette:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dowd... We're even now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH PAST Tommy, to TWO FIGURES huddled at a desk in the  corner. ROGER looks on as EDDIE rifles through a DOSSIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza's security clearance to go  inside the jails for parole hearings.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: A passport-type snapshot of the chubby, bald, bearded,  bespectacled ART ESPARZA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful work Esparza does...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND ESPARZA'S FILE
dialogues.text: Pictures, warrants, complaints. We can't make out the fin print, only the PHOTOS as Eddie flips through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipping back two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NEXT PHOTO - A grainy telephoto shot of Esparza emerg from Art's Supplies. His hair was thicker, he was thinner Wore a walrus moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza was being watched by Narco.  Suspected of using his warehouse as  a drug drop... Surveillance  terminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEXT PHOTO - A set of mugshots. Esparza is dramatically  thinner here. Lots more hair. Aviator glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years ago. Esparza charged with  assault. Dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEXT PHOTO - More mugshots. Esparza even thinner. Hair  thicker, longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accessory to extortion. Dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie flips, faster, through the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed for lack of evidence.  Dismissed, dismissed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger looks questioningly at Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little prick is protected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances, suddenly skittish, at Tommy -- who picks up o Eddie's paranoia and promptly reciprocates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it -- I'm outta here. You owe  me one, Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frowning, Eddie returns his attention to the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismissed...

dialogues.speaker: ESPARZA'S FACE
dialogues.text: As he gets younger, the moustache shrinks. Seven years ba and it disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dismissed. Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years ago: Esparza's black hair is cut in a shag, a the glasses are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something new in Eddie's voice commands Roger's attention

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen this picture before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his wallet, pulls out Shu's old mugshot.  Holds the two mugshots next to each other. Hushed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
