dialogues.text: They could've been brothers. It's  why the eyewitnesses picked Shu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... Shu is innocent.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Given that they're of different races, the resemblance be Art Esparza and Shu Kai Kim, in 1980, is startling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The killer wasn't Chinese"... Cecil  Stipe was right. .!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else was wrong and the one  fucking lunatic was right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger wears a tense smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean Kennedy was killed by  the phone company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two lawyers hurry out. Roger smiles at the DESK SERGE with exaggerated amiability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet intensity) But Shu's gun is an absolute match...!  How could that be, goddammit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyers bound down the steps, dart into the street--  -- and are nearly run down by an AMBULANCE that whizzes p pulling into the garage of the County Coroner's Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least we'd already be at the Morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briskly shaking off their brush with eternity, Eddie and  Roger proceed down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's make a citizen's arrest of  Esparza! We'll need back-up... Who's  the meanest motherfucker you ever  got off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Roger ducks into a phone booth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, Rog. Esparza's nobody.  This goes higher than him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger feeds the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta start somewhere. Gimme a name --  any client who owns a Magnum. (beat) Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's staring at the PHONE BOOTH. It's pagoda-style, wi Chinese-red pent roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie squints down the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even at this late hour we see enough decoration and signa to recognize Chinatown, not seven blocks uptown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) How long did it take Badalato to  drive Jimmy Chin's body from Chinatown  to the morgue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... An hour. (realizes) That's why I thought the morgue was  on the other side of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie fairly pushes Roger out of the phone booth. Thumbs  through the White Pages, finds the page he's looking for, tears it out and stuffs it into his pocket. As he races for his Riviera, parked in a towaway zone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger... I may be late for court  this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hops in, revs the old heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill in for me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Eddie peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mammoth '50s housing project by the East River. The  monolithic buildings are like giant tombstones jutting in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. The front door buzzer BUZZES. We HEAR a groggy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Who the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frowzy CONNIE BADALATO snaps ON a LIGHT. Reflexively re for the bottle of Seagrams on her night-table.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: stands the long-haired creep from last week's murder tria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope I didn't wake you. I'm Edward  C. Dowd. You're Mrs. Badalato?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie waves her bottle of scotch like a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Vin's sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you do. At this hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he brushes past her, Connie grabs his ponytail. Eddie  whirls and grabs Connie's bottle -- waves it over her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme back my bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie lets go, Eddie relinquishes her bottle. As he back up, toward Badalato's bedroom, he points a finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a good dog, Connie hangs back. Whimpering, slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie gasps -- stops short. Badalato lies propped up in his robe and socks. He's star at the test pattern of a TV on his bureau. He's dead. No he's not... Expressionless, still staring ahead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie crosses to the inert ex-cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Eddie Dowd. I cross-examined  you. (beat) But not very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato's eyes are shiny as marbles. On his night-table notice a half-dozen prescription vials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with Jimmy Chin's  body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato's lips part, but there's no sound. Eddie shakes  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with Jimmy Chin's  body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato's lids flutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought it... to the coroner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour after you picked it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato reaches for a vial, casually fishes out two pill Drowsily concedes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Chinatown... Which is right up  the street from the morgue! Where  did you go with the body? What did  you do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I need to sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie slams Badalato up against the headboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fishing. You don't know shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about Esparza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud crosses Badalato's face. OS, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It wasn't Vin's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie has advanced to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose idea was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato tries to focus on his sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie get outta here... this is  official business...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pressured... Tell the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit Connie -- go back to bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she backs out of the room, to Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little guys always take the rap  for the big shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growls) Connie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie leaves. Eddie turns back to Badalato. Before he ca resume his inquisition:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell... one of my partners... he  said it'd work if it was a thru-and  thru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie inhales sharply. Lets go of the ex-cop. His voice  shrinking to a near-whisper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a "thru-and-thru"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato reaches for another pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this chronic pain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the pill, leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight years I'm waiting for some  genius to notice it took me an hour  to drive seven blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets his eyes close. One, two, three beats. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drove Chin's body to The Firing  Line. Pistol range, near the Battery.  Lotta cops used to go there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH BACK to NOVEMBER 2, 1980:

dialogues.speaker: MOVING
dialogues.text: As he pulls the paddywagon into an alley, marked by a sig overhead: "THE FIRING LINE". The SHOT has the floating qu and irresistible forward motion of a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sklaroff brought Shu Kai Kim's gun.  Montell was already there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato (younger, fit) lifts his end of the stretcher be the sheet-covered corpse. Slides it out, to Montell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said we'd only have three hours.  After that, with the body cooling,  and the clotting... it wouldn't look  right to the pathologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops squat beside the stretcher. Badalato strips the  bloody sheet down to the corpse's waist. Sklaroff grips J Chin's shoulders and carefully hoists his torso upright.  Chin's head lolls, empty eyes staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chin was hit once in the forehead by  Esparza's .32. The bullet exited  clean. (beat) That's a thru-and-thru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato gingerly tugs on a hank of Chin's hair, to raise the corpse's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Montell had to worry about was  firing Kim's .38 at the same angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell, with gloved hand, brings Shu's gun to Jimmy Chin forehead. Tilts it, just so. And FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the GUN-BLAST, no less loud as it echoes in h head eight years later, has startled open Badalato's eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recovered the bullet and that was  it -- an airtight case...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is trying to wrap his mind around this awful thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? All to protect Esparza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato reaches, unsteadily, for another pill. His lids  have drooped again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty little bastard. He stepped in  shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato's head slumps. The impact of his chin striking h chest surprises him awake again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we had to lick his boots clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes) He was your snitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sardonic smile) Our own Colombian Connection... For  three years... Three years of ball  breaking detective work. And we put  a lotta bad guys behind bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato reaches for the vial again. Eddie grabs it first Reads the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demerol? What the fuck is your  problem, man? You wanna die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dead. We're both dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hurls the open vial across the room: the pills scat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody dies till I hear the truth!  Who ordered the frame on Shu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato stubbornly shakes his heavy head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was wrong, Vinnie -- you know  that! But we can make it right... if  you'll fucking stand up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato looks up at Eddie. His eyes fill with tears. Sti he doesn't move. Eddie grabs the ex-cop's pudgy hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, godammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Eddie hauls Badalato off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie drags Badalato past Connie, chewing her cuticles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the nearest hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bellevue. Straight up First --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato is slumped in the corner. The car descends with  painful slowness. Eddie nudges Badalato's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay awake, Badalato. Vinnie... Come  on, man, talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato's response: A faint SNORTING sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say snort? No, I said talk.  Please... I need you to live... (an idea) Hey: When was the first time you got  laid? (no answer, then) Okay, I sympathize, I blocked mine  out myself. She had a moustache...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the car stops. The door creakily slides open. As  Eddie pulls the hulking ex-cop upright:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where're we goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That-a-boy. Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don' need a hospital... I feel  fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too fine, Badalato. The bad news is,  you're gonna live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response Badalato GURGLES -- it sounds, disconcertingl like a death rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make y'a deal. You clean up, I clean  up. No more dope. (amends) No more dope for a year. (amends) For the rest of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hauls Badalato OUT of the elevator, and right into --  SKLAROFF AND MONTELL Montell, the burlier of the two, fli Eddie against the wall. With an odd, brutal melancholy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to come here, you  hippie-dippie fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime Sklaroff helps Badalato down the access stairs a he murmurs soothing assurances in the ex-cop's ear. As Montell roughly pat-searches Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell... listen to me: Vinnie took  a buncha pills. He needs a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes two of ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knees Eddie in the groin, then tosses him into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie tumbles down the short flight. Then picks himself u as Montell hurtles after him. Eddie makes a break, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but ESPARZA's waiting here. He hauls off, smashing Eddie' head against the concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit Art, get back in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime Sklaroff walks Badalato past a row of dark sedan huddled like hearses... Past a mesh gate that guards the  building's ancient furnaces, crackling with flame, spewin steam... To an UNMARKED CAR parked at the far end of the  garage. Softly, suppressing his unbearable tension:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vin... What'd you tell the lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the back door, maneuvers Badalato onto the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With infinite kindness, infinite patience:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Vin. So's Dave. We need to  know what you told the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato nods, slowly. A stoned, beatific smile forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came clean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain stabs Sklaroff's face. He pats Badalato's knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Vinnie... You wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts back to where Montell and Esparza stand over Eddie, Sklaroff draws the gun from his shoulder-holster. His face, in the dirty yellow flourescent light down here is a taut, shiny death mask. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinnie told 'im everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woozily, as he mops the blood from his brow with a sleeve

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, "everything"? You shot a corpse.  I don't give a shit about that -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's snuff this lowlife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Esparza) Hey -- the fact you popped Jimmy  Chin in broad daylight proves it  wasn't premeditated. Jury'll  sympathize -- dude was banging your  wife, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your sewer mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lunges at Eddie. Montell pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing me in the middle of the trial  would cause quite a stink... (to Esparza) It won't be clean like with Chuckie.  What, y'treat him to a match-head of  pure smack...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esparza shakes Montell loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- I'm a generous guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell gazes with loathing at Esparza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Who'd y'waste now, Art?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meantime Sklaroff levels the gun at Eddie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. So we can go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sklaroff's finger twitches, on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still letting your snitch run you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sklaroff's eyes flash. Eddie's touched a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou... We have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waste him, y'little worm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sklaroff's gaze flies from Esparza to Eddie to Montell. A four men's faces are slick with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draws his .32) Okay then I'll put this filthy lawyer  freak out of his mis--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly Sklaroff swivels, jams his gun against Esparza's ear and FIRES. As Esparza topples backward, eyes and mout wide:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie jumps up in horror. Montell blinks at Sklaroff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda done that eight years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waving his gun at Esparza's ruined head, Sklaroff hoarsel shouts at Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? You wanna be like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking swear to shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell registers shock at his partner's offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We can't trust this fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Eddie) You gonna keep quiet -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie considers for a moment that feels like forever. The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that... Keep quiet? You  can't ask me to do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explodes) Shoot 'im, f'r Chrissakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate, Sklaroff kicks Esparza's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the motherfucker killed Jimmy  Chin. It's justice...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie nods... he agrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have a client eight years in  prison didn't do it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell grabs the gun from Sklaroff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sorry bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes fixed on the gun, Eddie takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy's gotta walk. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montell swallows hard, then raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what I'm saying? It's over --  all the bullshit. Your bullshit, my  bullshit -- all the lies -- that's  it, party's over, enough's enough...  Y'live a lie, you die inside -- don't  you know that? (then, softly) I have to go now. I have to be in  court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns.

dialogues.speaker: MONTELL'S GUN
dialogues.text: Pointed at Eddie's back. His finger tightens on the trigg

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: crosses the oil-stained concrete... past the row of black sedans, the clanking furnaces... barely able to breathe.. waiting for the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: MONTELL'S ARM
dialogues.text: starts to shake, just slightly. He brings up his other ar to steady the gun.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: has traversed this humid half-acre of hell... he reaches unmarked car. A bleary Badalato looks up at him, Eddie ho out a hand. His voice catching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinnie... You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badalato reaches up. And takes Eddie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: MONTELL AND SKLAROFF
dialogues.text: Sklaroff places his hand on Montell's wrist. He helps his partner slowly lower the gun. Party's over.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND BADALATO
dialogues.text: awkwardly walk up the ramp. The sun is just rising over N York City. The two men squint as they come into the light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pillars have bailed out. Shu sits at the Defense Tabl Not happy to be here. Roger stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, Mr. Dowd indicated that  he may be detained this morning...  He asked me to fill in for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't amuse me, Mr. B--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. It's EDDIE. Tattered, bruised and tired.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PROSECUTION TABLE
dialogues.text: Rabin nudges Reynard. It appears that the defense has bee on a titanic bender.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: The Judge puts on a sarcastic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Dowd. Do you think  you might be up to cross-examining  Mr. Ortega this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor: I imagine that, no matter  how careful my questioning, Mr. Ortega  would, in his well-intentioned way,  dig my client's hole even deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy nods. Not without a trace of compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, does the defense have any  witnesses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I could find an inmate  who'd say that Shu boasted about  Chinatown just to survive in the  joint -- though he didn't really do  it...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Shu looks up. Interested, again, in the proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I could find witnesses to  dispute every point made by the D.A.  But in the end, would we be any closer  to understanding what really happened  eight years ago? As Mr. Reynard has  said, these matters are cloaked in  secrecy... How can we, here in the  safety and sanctity of this court,  presume to pass judgment on Shu Kai  Kim, a refugee...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Reynard trades smug looks with Rabin and starts packing h briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who has spent his young adulthood  like a caged animal in a prison where  kill or be killed was the code...

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: His impatience tinged with pity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Then you don't wish to call any  witnesses, Mr. Dowd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to put Shu's alleged  crime in a context, your Honor. And  we do have the foremost expert on  prison and street gangs right here  in this room... If it please the  court, I'd like to call Mr. Reynard.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: DEAN RABIN looks outraged. REYNARD is merely annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would ask opposing counsel to make  an offer of proof that this is  anything more than a desperate tactic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you both approach the bench...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard strides up. As Eddie joins him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Can't Mr. Dowd find his own expert  witness, your Honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd need a continuance. Three weeks  at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy sighs. He doesn't have three weeks to waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your questions would of course be  restricted to Mr. Reynard's area of  expertise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a last-ditch ploy, your Honor...  The Defense clearly hopes that my  presence on the stand will create  the opportunity to call for a  mistrial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flashes Eddie a grim smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Defense is mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard proceeds to the witness box. Though it's clearly formality, the D.A. must be sworn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the  whole truth and nothing but the truth,  so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie ambles over to the witness box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start by establishing your  credentials as an expert witness,  Mr. Reynard. In the late '70s you  led an investigation into a Colombian  crime syndicate called "the Ochoa"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As though indulging a child:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't this investigation, with its  attendant publicity, catapult you  into the office you now hold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were sitting where I normally  sit, I would say "Calls for  speculation."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE JURORS are charmed by Reynard's ironic bonhomie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do any hands-on work or did  you just supervise, from on high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dowd, I was personally involved  with all phases -- and principals --  of the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who were the detectives who  assisted you, Mr. Reynard?

dialogues.speaker: REYNARD
dialogues.text: glances into Eddie's eyes, to read what's behind them.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: His expression gives away nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Reynard, as he answers, manages to sound perfectly casual

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou Sklaroff, Vin Badalato, Dave  Montell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same three detectives on the  Jimmy Chin case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy perks up considerably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In those days, they often worked as  a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who was Arturo Esparza?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard hesitates. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I know that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But you just said you were  personally involved with all the  principals of the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be expected to remember the  name of every informant eight years  after the fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say he was an informant.  But since you mentioned it, wasn't  Esparza your primary informant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bristles) You're trespassing into the area of  witness protection, Mr. Dowd. Such  showboating puts lives at risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heedless, Eddie hammers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it true that without Esparza,  you had no investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scalding contempt) I think you're a dangerous man, Mr.  Dowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so, Mr. Reynard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie moves in closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the night of November 2, 1980,  did Art Esparza phone you at home to  say, "I just killed a man in Chinatown --  people saw me do it"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REPORTERS trade looks, then start to madly scribble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ice) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Then what did he say?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN RABIN
dialogues.text: has no idea what's going on. All he knows is that he must something. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. Badgering the witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Quealy's withering glance causes the Deputy D.A. to sink back down and stay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd worked too hard to let Esparza's  crime of passion spoil everything.  You ordered your team to comb through  the mugbooks. Find a patsy. Frame  him. (beat) Protect your case. (beat) Protect your career. Isn't that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COURTROOM sucks in a collective breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an outrageous accus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynard trails off as, in the back of the courtroom:

dialogues.speaker: VIN BADALATO
dialogues.text: is helped into the courtroom by CONNIE. Who pointedly sit her brother behind the defense, with Kitty and Mrs. Kim.

dialogues.speaker: REYNARD
dialogues.text: A cornered animal. His gaze flicks from Badalato to Eddie

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: This time Eddie returns Reynard's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Putting away one punk enabled you to  keep your informant out of prison  and in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHU has gone pale. Tears stream down MRS. KIM's face. KIT reaches an arm around her shoulders, to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By keeping your informant out of  prison and in place, you were able  to complete your work. Ultimately  you saved scores of lives, didn't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Now Eddie invokes the D.A.'s pet principle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a trade-off, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly, with a kind of tragic dignity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trade-off, yes... (then) I'd do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie nods. Then returns to the defense table and sits,  between Roger and Shu. Eddie looks drained but exalted. H can sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense rests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu Kai Kim sits on the edge of his cot. Listens to the E of FOOTSTEPS that grow LOUDER. In eight years of waiting, man learns patience. The FOOTSTEPS STOP, tumblers TURN. Still, Shu doesn't mov moving might break the spell. The cell DOOR slides OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kim. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shu emerges from the Main Gate, toting a sad little vinyl valise. Blinking, as though he hasn't seen daylight in ye He heads toward the concrete depot where a bus will take south, to New York City. How strange to walk without shac handcuffs, armed guards. OS he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edward C. Dowd lounges against his Riviera. Shu cocks his head, stares at the lawyer. Eddie shrugs, stares down. Three beats. When he looks up Shu is standing before him. Searching for words. Failing find them. At last:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, man -- let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ROGER steps out of the car, holds open the door for S

dialogues.speaker: THE RIVIERA
dialogues.text: Spewing clouds of pollution, Eddie's car pulls away. RISE over the turrets and towers and electrified fences a Eddie, Roger and Shu drive away from the prison, to freed
